Updated November     pm



MONDAY Oct PERIOD   HealthDay News  Adults with bipolar disorders have a higher body mass index BMI and a higher prevalence of obesity than the general population according to a study published online Sept PERIOD  in the The American Journal of Psychiatry PERIOD

Hemen Najar M.D. from Sahlgrenska Academy at the University of Gothenburg in Sweden and colleagues investigated trends and distribution of body mass index BMI among individuals with bipolar disorders and the general population between  and  PERIOD The analysis included  adults with bipolar disorders and  adults from the Swedish general population PERIOD

The researchers found that BMI percentiles were higher among individuals with bipolar disorders PERIOD The BMI group differences were . for men and . for women at the fiftieth percentile and were widest at the eighty-fifth BMI percentile men . women . pERIOD Over time BMI increased in both groups but more so in the group with bipolar disorders PERIOD The highest prevalence and the greatest rate of increase of obesity were seen among women with bipolar disorders PERIOD The obesity prevalence in  was  percent among women and  percent among men with bipolar disorders versus  and  percent respectively among women and men in the general population PERIOD

 Najar said in a statement PERIOD 

One author disclosed ties to the pharmaceutical industry PERIOD
